Topic.Title: Sybil haz an amazing prediction for todayz action

Message.Msg: "It is pure hype to suggest anything other than declining inventory turns and ROIC as both have dropped consistently nearly every quarter since blah, blah..." Yes, something like that is exactly what shorts said during the previous expansion cycle by shorts cherry picking certain self-serving data points that ended up being predictive of nothing. You're doing the same thing. "you didn't respond to Chicago locations of TGT, with several right downtown. I have 2 within 5 miles..." Case closed. Last mile? Try the last 5 miles. If that is such a hot spot then why don't all the stores (Best Buy sells lots of physical goods) crying about Amazon putting them out of business simply move right next to Target? "As Amazon has expanded, the category economics keep getting worse / less well suited to online versus physical commerce." I guess you must have better data than Walmart and Target execs who were so scared to death once they realized people used Kindles to buy physical goods with. Note they did not ban nooks or iPads as the makers of those items do not compete head to head with Amazon for general physical merchandise. Case closed. You lose. And spewing words like hype and pump all you like won't change the fact that you showed up here around $180 and the stock went over $260. This says all that is needed about the utter puniness of your tiny investing mind. Again, you fail to understand the profit drivers and the embedded tradeoffs in the business model.

Topic.Title: Sybil haz an amazing prediction for todayz action

Message.Msg: "I''m not long any retailer." Because you know how bleak their prospects are saddled with much higher cost structures in place when attempting to match prices with Amazon. Either this will drive the former out of business or out of many product lines that Amazon dominates or will come to dominate. Or they will capitulate and simply concede a large part of the market to Amazon and other online sellers. "I was actually surprised by how few TGT's there are in Manhattan" I wasn't. You need a big car to load up at discount superstores for things. People in Manhattan don't want to sit in traffic all day. They take a cab or the subway or walk to where they are going or have drivers drive them. People of that income bracket do not consider pinching pennies at TGT. They don't mind paying a reasonable price for the convenience of shopping online and just having things delivered. Sure. Some wealthy New Yorker is going to pay for a driver and limo and waste everyone's sweet time just for the pleasure of saving a few pennies by shopping at TGT because some lame short (you) begged him to. Only a nano brain would think otherwise of such areas. Again, you don't understand discount physical retailers at all. The business model is to locate outside of higher rent areas overwhelmingly. They need as low a cost structure as possible to compete, the inconvenience of their location is the tradeoff for lower cost.

Message.Title: Pivotal will eat Amazon's AWS
Message.Msg: The biggest challenger to Amazon's AWS became reality. Pivotal will focus solely on providing cloud services - it is just a matter of time when competition drives down pricing. With such a high Price-Earnings multiple, Amazon is on very very shaky ground. Finally, the shorts will have their day after a decade-long unrealistically supported argument of "we don't care about profits, we're growing revenue".

Message.Title: AMZN
Message.Msg: Will NOT correct. It will crash. The last four earnings releases had a swing of 50 points from the day before, the day of, after hours and the next day. it also managed to be up over twenty points in 3 day. This based on consecutive worse quarters. The great surprise this time will be down earnings BUT the 30 point seing will be to the downside.

Topic.Title: AMZN

Message.Msg: Amazon isn't going to lose 30 points. It will lose 80+ in the next 3 months... if it is lucky. Q1 window dressing is done. This has ZERO chance of outperforming virtually any stock (except other scams on the same order like NFLX, LNKD, etc). Those that get out early, get out best. Once earnings hit there will be no one adding. They've already squeezed shorts and vol about as hard as they can. They short squeeze opportunity actually sits with undervalued companies at this point...
